channel.title: math.CV updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CV updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Equidistribution of the conjugates of algebraic units
item.description: arXiv:2504.11599v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove an equidistribution result for the zeros of polynomials with integer coefficients and simple zeros. Specifically, we show that the normalized zero measures associated with a sequence of such polynomials, having small height relative to a certain compact set in the complex plane, converge to a canonical measure on the set. In particular, this result gives an equidistribution result for the conjugates of algebraic units, in the spirit of Bilu's work. Our approach involves lifting these polynomials to polynomial mappings in two variables and proving an equidistribution result for the normalized zero measures in this setting.
item.dc:creator: Norm Levenberg, Mayuresh Londhe

item.title: Multiscale differentials and wonderful models
item.description: arXiv:2504.11534v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study the relationships between several varieties parametrizing marked curves with differentials in the literature. More precisely, we prove that the space $\mathcal{B}_n$ of multiscale differentials of genus 0 with $n+1$ marked points of orders $(0,\ldots,0,-2)$ is a wonderful variety. This shows that the Chow ring of $\mathcal{B}_n$ is generated by the classes of a collection of smooth boundary divisors with normal crossings subject to simple and explicit linear and quadratic relations. Furthermore, we realize $\mathcal{B}_n$ as a subvariety of the space $\mathcal{A}_n$ of multiscale lines and prove that $\mathcal{B}_n$ can be realized as the normalized Chow quotient of $\mathcal{A}_n$ by a natural $\mathbb{C}^*$-action.
item.dc:creator: Prabhat Devkota, Antonios-Alexandros Robotis, Adrian Zahariuc

item.title: H\"older regularity of the $\bar\partial-$equation on the polydisc
item.description: arXiv:2301.04484v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this note, we show the existence of a solution operator to the $\bar\partial-$equation in the polydisc that preserves H\"older regularity. This solution operator is constructed using Henkin's formula. It is a well-known fact that solution operators to the $\bar\partial-$equation on product domains do not improve H\"older regularity. Hence, this solution operator is optimal in that regard.
item.dc:creator: Yu Jun Loo, Alexander Tumanov

item.title: Paley-Wiener Theorems For Slice Regular Functions
item.description: arXiv:2502.14489v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove two theorems of Paley and Wiener in the slice regular setting. As an application, we can compute the reproducing kernel for the slice regular Paley-Wiener space, and obtain a related sampling theorem.
item.dc:creator: Yanshuai Hao, Pei Dang, Weixiong Mai
